adjectives.description: toothsome (comparative more toothsome, superlative most toothsome)

entries.meaning: (by extension of sense 1, and by analogy to slang tasty) Sexually attractive.
Having a pleasing texture when bitten.
examples: Once the pasta is firmly al dente (toothsome but not snappy), add it into the pan, with a bunch of cheese, and cook til it all becomes glossy.

Bagels are fine, but give me a warm bialy any time. With its crisp bits of onion nestled snugly into a golden pillow of toothsome chewiness, this is the ideal substrate for lox and a schmear—or just on its own.
